intro: Maytenus vitis-idaea, commonly known as the common mayten, is a species of flowering plant in the family Celastraceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly in Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves, which are often opposite or whorled, and its small, inconspicuous flowers that develop into berries. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
